ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] emergency: please read reguarding new bard songs
ygData.msgSnippet: Hehehehehe! Ok, I kind of see where you re going with this.  And it would be neat to have bard buffs that dramatically increase stats for a shor period of
ygData.messageBody:
Hehehehehe!

Ok, I kind of see where you're going with this. And it would be neat to
have bard buffs that dramatically increase stats for a shor period of time.

Good point :)




-----Original Message-----
From: Ryan Honeyman [mailto:honeyman@...]
Sent: Tuesday, March 21, 2000 2:09 PM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] emergency: please read reguarding new bard songs


From: Ryan Honeyman <honeyman@...>

> I'm not exactly sure what you mean about Shaman buffing without exceeding
> their regen rate....
> I can buff TWO people fully before I'm out of mana. Yes, some of the
buffs
> last longer but if I"m debuffing during the fight, and I am even needed to
> SLIGHTLY heal, i'm the one holding the group up. In fact, it is nearly
> impossible for me to keep FULL buffs up on my groups unless that's about
all
> I'm doing.


Let's put it this way: Once you buff those two people and you are oom
you don't have to buff them for over an hour. If you are doing full
buffs, then chances are you are not the primary healer.

My buff lasts a whopping 6 secs. And is half the power of yours.
That's ridiculous. Not only does it last 1/600th of the time
but it does 1/2 the boost.

Our party songs should exceed any other player class buffs for
the pure reason that they are extremely temporary. Well that's
my reasoning. It may not be 100% correct, but sheeeit.

Harmonic.
